sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"边，边缘"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: edge, border, margin, rim, verge, brim, fringe
means: edge ： 普通用词，指较窄的边沿。
border ： 侧重刚好在界线内的一部分表面上，指较宽的边缘，也可指边缘本身。
margin ： 指物体的空白边，一般较宽。
rim ： 指圆形或有曲线的物体的边缘。
verge ： 指明显地标志一个表在或一广阔空间的边界，或终端线，也指极狭窄的空间。常用作比喻。
brim ： 指深容器的内边或河、湖等水域的最高线。
fringe ： 指地毯的须边、围巾的花边、烫发的卷边或人群的边缘。

sentence.Network_cn: 一度身体欠佳令她表现有失水准。

phrase.cizu_name: on the edge of one's seat

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)very excited and giving one's full attention to something
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)十分兴奋的，兴奋得坐不住的；全神贯注的

jx.jx_en_mean: (especially of an unpleasantly harsh sound) cause someone to feel intense discomfort or irritation
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指刺耳声音）使人觉得牙根发痒，使人觉得十分刺耳

lj.lj_ly: a grating that set her teeth on edge.
lj.lj_ls: 让她觉得牙根发痒的刺耳磨擦声。

jx.jx_en_mean: reduce the intensity or effect of (something unpleasant or severe)

lj.lj_ly: the tablets will take the edge off the pain.
lj.lj_ls: 这些药片可以减轻疼痛。

jx.jx_en_mean: To surpass or beat by a small margin
jx.jx_cn_mean: 排挤掉：以微弱优势超过或胜过

lj.lj_ls: 下坡滑雪赛的选手将她的对手慢慢挤出中央跑道

jx.jx_en_mean: In a state of keen excitement, as from danger or risk
jx.jx_cn_mean: 激动，兴奋：处于高度兴奋状态，如由危险或冒险引起的

lj.lj_ls: “由一触即发的战斗引起的激动”(&b{纳尔逊·德米耶})

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English ecg 'sharpened side of a blade', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch egge and German Ecke, also to Old Norse eggja (see egg), from an Indo-European root shared by Latin acies 'edge' and Greek akis 'point'

entry.def: The edge of something is the place or line where it stops, or the part of it that is furthest from the middle.

example.ex: We were on a hill, right on the edge of town...
example.tran: 我们在恰位于城镇边缘的一座小山上。

example.ex: She was standing at the water's edge...

entry.def: The edge of something sharp such as a knife or an axe is its sharp or narrow side.
If someone or something edges somewhere, they move very slowly in that direction.

example.ex: He edged closer to the telephone, ready to grab it...
example.tran: 他慢慢挪向电话机，准备抓起听筒。

example.ex: He is edging ahead in the opinion polls.
example.tran: 他在民意测验中的支持率正一点点攀升。

entry.def: The edge of something, especially something bad, is the point at which it may start to happen.

example.ex: They have driven the rhino to the edge of extinction...
example.tran: 他们已经令犀牛濒临灭绝。

example.ex: She was on the edge of tears.

entry.def: If someone or something has an edge, they have an advantage that makes them stronger or more likely to be successful than another thing or person.

example.ex: The three days France have to prepare could give them the edge over England...
example.tran: 法国有3天的准备时间，这可能会让他们在对阵英格兰时占上风。

example.ex: Through superior production techniques they were able to gain the competitive edge.
example.tran: 凭借先进的生产技术，他们得以占据竞争优势。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something has an edge, you mean that they have a powerful quality.

example.ex: Featuring new bands gives the show an edge...
example.tran: 以新乐队为主打是这次演出的一个亮点。

example.ex: Greene's stories had an edge of realism.
example.tran: 格林的小说有强烈的现实主义色彩。

entry.def: If someone's voice has an edge to it, it has a sharp, bitter, or emotional quality.

example.ex: But underneath the humour is an edge of bitterness...
example.tran: 但是幽默的背后却透着怨气。

example.ex: There was a nervous edge to his voice.

entry.def: If you or your nerves are on edge, you are tense, nervous, and unable to relax.

example.ex: My nerves were constantly on edge.
example.tran: 我的神经时刻处于紧绷状态。

entry.def: If you say that someone is on the edge of their seat or chair, you mean that they are very interested in what is happening or what is going to happen.

example.ex: Most of the time the audience is on the edge of its seat.
example.tran: 大多数时候，观众都屏息凝神。

entry.def: If you say that a person or a piece of entertainment has rough edges, you mean that they have some small faults, although generally you approve of them.

example.ex: The show, despite some rough edges, was an instant success.
example.tran: 虽然有一些瑕疵，演出还是一举获得了成功。

entry.def: If something takes the edge off a situation, usually an unpleasant one, it weakens its effect or intensity.

example.ex: A spell of poor health took the edge off her performance.
example.tran: 一度身体欠佳令她表现有失水准。

means.word_mean: 2. a sharp side formed by the intersection of two surfaces of an object;

sentences.sentence: "he rounded the edges of the box"

means.word_mean: 3. a line determining the limits of an area

sentences.sentence: "his voice had an edge to it"
"he had an edge on the competition"

means.word_mean: 6. a strip near the boundary of an object;

sentences.sentence: "he jotted a note on the margin of the page"

means.word_mean: 1. advance slowly, as if by inches;
2. provide with a border or edge;
3. lie adjacent to another or share a boundary;

example.en: This gadget is brand new. It's really on the bleeding edge.
example.zh: 这玩意儿是一种新东西。它是真正具有最先进技术的。

It is going to lose its competitive edge in higher education.

The proof, which was published last week in Science, comes from a team of scientists from Uppsala University in Sweden and California Institute of Technology who drew deep holes near the edge of ice sheet.

sentences.en: The knife is blunt.I'll edge it.
sentences.cn: 这把刀钝了, 我要把它磨一磨。

means.word_mean: 慢慢向前移动, 侧身移动

jushi.chinese: 这种硬木会使锯齿卷曲。

jushi.english: The river determined the edge of the property.
